title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', src/librustc/hir/mod.rs:81:37

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-hir
labels.description: Area: the High level Intermediate Representation (HIR)

body:
OS: Fedora 31, amd64
Rust version is `rustc 1.44.0-nightly (f509b26a7 2020-03-18)`

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', src/librustc/hir/mod.rs:81:37
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.44.0-nightly (f509b26a7 2020-03-18) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C codegen-units=4 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: could not compile `docopt`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
```
